messages.title: MARK PRISK SEEKS RE-ELECTION
messages.content: Mark Prisk MP has announced that he will be seeking re-election on May 7th, as the Conservative candidate for Hertford & Stortford.

messages.title: HERTFORD POST OFFICE SAVED
messages.content: The Post Office services in Hertford will still be available at the new premises.

messages.title: MORE HELP FOR CARERS
messages.content: Support for those who care for family members will be further increased.

messages.title: TACKLING DEMENTIA
messages.content: Government's new plan for tackling the dementia challenge will include increased funding and a new international dementia institute.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Government's new plan includes increased funding for dementia care, investment of £300m in dementia research, and setting up a new international dementia institute.

mentions.candidate: Mark Prisk MP presenting a petition to the Prime Minister; Mark Prisk MP intervenes on Post Office

issues.economy: Over the years Mark had helped secure funding for local NHS, new rail service, broadband and other services aiming to turn the economy around.
issues.environment: Tidy up efforts; Goods Yard Bridge improvements
issues.health: Tackling Dementia; Hertford Post Office - includes NHS services

housing.content: Parking restrictions while preserving essential services.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured funding for local NHS, new rail service, and broadband among others.

images.caption: Mark Prisk MP delivering a petition to the Prime Minister against the proposed closure of Bishop’s Stortford Police Station.
Renovation and improvement works at the Memorial Gardens in Hertford.
Prospective candidate Holly Drake pictured here outside Bishop’s Stortford Community Hospital.
